definition: to be furious/to fly into a terrible rage
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
see 大夫[dai4 fu5]
to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)
surname Lei
thunder/mine (weapon)/(Internet slang) terrifying/terrific
clap of thunder

sentences.english: She raged against her husband for some household affairs.
sentences.chinese: 她爲一些家庭瑣事對丈夫大發雷霆。

sentences.english: When Alex began to discuss, chaussures homme, Richard explosion into a rage.
sentences.chinese: 當阿列克斯開始爭論時，理查德便大發雷霆。

sentences.english: Last night, I stomped into our bedroom ready to turn on my anger at full volume.
sentences.chinese: 昨晚，我跺着腳進臥室，準備大發雷霆。

sentences.english: Example: When I told Raymand that someone has taken his candy box away, he went through the roof.
sentences.chinese: 當雷蒙德聽我說他的糖果盒被人拿走的時候大發雷霆。

sentences.english: She often hits the roof because of trifles.
sentences.chinese: 她常爲雞毛蒜皮的小事大發雷霆。

sentences.english: When Alex began to argue, Richard burst into a rage.
sentences.chinese: 當阿列克斯開始爭論時，理查德便大發雷霆。

sentences.english: The veteran crooner took out his anger over a leaked record on a producer.
sentences.chinese: 這位老牌歌手因唱片歌曲被泄露，向製作人大發雷霆。

sentences.english: Her father raved at her when she disobeyed him.
sentences.chinese: 她不聽父親的話，她父親大發雷霆。

sentences.english: The King flared up. He wanted the prime minister left and called the palace wizard.
sentences.chinese: 國王大發雷霆，要總理大臣離開，把宮廷魔法師找來。

sentences.english: Your mom is going to be furious when she finds out what happened.
sentences.chinese: 你母親發現發生了什麼事情之後會大發雷霆的。

sentences.english: Mother raised the roof when she saw the dog's muddy foot prints on her new bedspread.
sentences.chinese: 看見新牀單上有狗的泥腳印時，媽媽大發雷霆。

sentences.english: Jane:' She's bent out of shape over the new dress code at work.
sentences.chinese: 她工作時爲新的女裙代碼大發雷霆。

sentences.english: Otherwise, he cannot remember too much apart from Ferguson shouting at everyone in the dressing room.
sentences.chinese: 但他記得最深刻的還是爵爺在更衣室裏大發雷霆。

sentences.english: I was so shocked when he flared up in front of everyone.
sentences.chinese: 他在大家面前大發雷霆的時候，我真是嚇壞了。

sentences.english: I told him what she had said about him and he did his nut.
sentences.chinese: 我把她議論他的話告訴了他，他大發雷霆。

sentences.english: Dad will hit the ceiling when I tell him I broke his camera.
sentences.chinese: 我告訴我爸我把他的照相機搞壞了的時候他大發雷霆。

definition: spitting anger (idiom); in a rage
to shout and scream (idiom); to kick up a fuss/to make a scene
to use violence (against sb)/to strong-arm sb/to manhandle
to smash
to volunteer for/to offer to undertake
to bawl out/to reprimand severely
to fly into a rage out of humiliation/to be ashamed into anger (idiom)
dumbstruck and unable to reply (idiom); left speechless/at a loss for words
the trick of injuring oneself to gain the enemy's confidence/CL:條|条[tiao2]
to offend
adopted daughter (traditional adoption, i.e. without legal ramifications)
to send (sb) away/to change the subject/to open (an umbrella etc)
to question intensely/to interrogate/to demand information
flustered and exasperated/utterly discomfited
shield/(fig.) excuse
to keep silent
